poem:
Title: "The Unhoused Under Florida Skies"

On cruel sidewalks where pity perishes,
Florida's displaced chattels find no reprieve. 
DeSantis declares, "No sleep amidst the leaves,"
and turns the drifters into Pariah stars.

Camps rise in the hollow of humanity's heart,
answer to the stark carceral desire.

A law that claims to cure but fuels the fire,
Touch not the earth; touch not our sacred art.
